question_text:
A survey was conducted to learn people's chocolate preferences.

What is the measure of the central angle in the "Milk chocolate" section?
_ °
backend_description: A circle graph showing chocolate preferences. The circle is divided into two equal halves: 'Milk chocolate' (50%, shown in orange/peach color) and 'Dark chocolate' (50%, shown in purple). Students need to find the central angle for the milk chocolate section.
solution_image_tag: Shows the calculation: 50% of 360° = 0.50 x 360° = 180°. This demonstrates how to convert the percentage shown in the circle graph to the corresponding central angle measurement.
solution: According to the graph, 50% of the respondents preferred milk chocolate.
Find 50% of 360°.
In the "Milk chocolate" section, the measure of the central angle is 180°.

question_text:

solution: According to the graph, 55% of the respondents preferred boy groups.
